meanings.definition: To make or become wider, larger, or more open
meanings.sent1: The flowers dilate in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The doctor used eye drops to dilate my pupils.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally dilate the balloon too much, and it popped!
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to dilate the room with warmth.
meanings.sent5: The hot air balloon began to dilate as it filled with gas.

meanings.definition: To speak or write at length on a subject
meanings.sent1: She tends to dilate on her favorite books for hours.
meanings.sent2: The professor likes to dilate on the history of ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent3: During the meeting, he started to dilate on his weekend plans by mistake.
meanings.sent4: His speech seemed to dilate on the importance of teamwork.
meanings.sent5: The author would dilate on the theme of love in her novels.
